definitions.definition: Modification or regulation of something to achieve an appropriate measure or proportion ; ( countable ) an instance of this.

subdefinitions.definition: Variation (especially softening or toning down ) of brightness , form , etc. ; ( countable ) an instance of this.
Variation in the activity or form of a cell in response to changes in the environment ; ( countable ) an instance of this.

Chiefly preceded by a descriptive word : modification of an electromagnetic wave or other oscillating carrier wave to apply a signal to it; ( countable ) an instance of this; also, the extent to which such a wave is modified; and the modified wave or signal.

Variation of the intensity , pitch , and tone of the sound of a musical instrument or voice ; inflection ; ( countable ) an instance of this. ( uncountable ) Changing of the key in a piece of music ; also, the effect achieved by this as an element of harmony ; ( countable ) an instance of this.
The quality of a typeface of having contrasting , thick and thin parts of the strokes ; stroke-width variation .
examples: Garamond has modulation , while Helvetica does not.

definitions.definition: Changing of a thing from one form to another; ( countable ) an instance of this.

subdefinitions.definition: Harmonious use of language in poetry or prose .

Modification of the parts of a classical Greek or Roman building to achieve appropriate proportions by measuring in modules ( “ standard units of measure , usually the diameter or radius of a column at the base of a shaft ” ) .

Any of the musical notes in ecclesiastical modes of music on which a melodic phrase had to begin and end . ( uncountable ) Arrangement or composition , or performance , of music in a certain key or mode; also ( countable ) a series of musical notes, chord , or tune analyzed according to a key or mode. ( uncountable ) Making music or singing ; ( countable ) a melody , a tune; also ( chiefly in the plural ) , a musical note.

main_definition: ( uncountable ) Modification or regulation of something to achieve an appropriate measure or proportion ; ( countable ) an instance of this.
secondary_definitions: ( uncountable ) Changing of a thing from one form to another; ( countable ) an instance of this.
